title: Employee Experience Onboarding Coordinator
content:
Who we are
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.
About the team
In this role, you’ll be joining the New Hire Programs (NHP) Team. The NHP team is responsible for creating effective and delightful new hire experiences at Stripe. Overall, our goal is to create a comprehensive and personalized onboarding experience that fosters a sense of community and facilitates rapid ramp to productivity for new hires. 
What you’ll do
You’ll be helping the new hire programs team support Stripe’s growth by coordinating the logistical details for our global employee onboarding program. This role will be based on-site in Dublin. 
Responsibilities

Manage the logistics of scheduling onboarding sessions, facilitators and participants for EMEA
Set up rooms and spaces for IRL onboarding
Coordinate and confirm facilitators and speakers who run our live sessions; including our functional onboarding partners
Manage communications to participants and their teammates
Provide positive user experience as you answer questions and address issues for new Stripes 

Who you are
We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.
Minimum requirements

3+ years of scheduling or coordination experience
Previous experience in a fast-paced environment
Ability to be a team player; adept at working with multiple people at any given time
Incredible organizational skills; superb attention to detail
Flexibility: able to shift tasks and priorities in a big way at the drop of a hat; comfortable working with ambiguity
Creativity and is process-driven: you’re constantly looking for ways to make things work more efficiently
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with an appropriate blend of professionalism and friendliness
Ability to connect and interact with different types of people

Preferred qualifications

 You are able to work with a high degree of autonomy and limited supervision
You are familiar with some of our core tools: Workday, Intellum, G Suite, Zoom, Slack
You enjoy documenting and improving workflows
You enjoy presenting or facilitating and can step in as needed

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
questions.label: If this role offers the option to work from a remote location, do you plan to work remotely?

values.label: Yes, I intend to work remotely.
No, I intend to work from an office location.
